DataElement.preferredName: CLIA Laboratory Procedure Post Chemotherapy ARCH Detection Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable related to the detection of Age-Related Clonal Hematopoiesis after chemotherapy with CLIA.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Laboratory Improvement Act Laboratory Procedure Post Chemotherapy Age-Related Clonal Hematopoiesis Detection
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A Federal law establishing quality standards for all laboratory testing to ensure the accuracy, reliability and timeliness of patient test results regardless of where the test was performed and also to determine if laboratories are achieving those standards._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order._The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases._The gradual, clonal expansion of hematopoietic stem and progenitor cells carrying specific, disruptive, and recurrent genetic variants, in individuals without clear diagnosis of hematological malignancies. It is associated with an increased risk of developing hematologic cancers._The activity of perceiving, discerning, discovering or identifying.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Clinical Laboratory Improvement Act Laboratory Procedure
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A Federal law establishing quality standards for all laboratory testing to ensure the accuracy, reliability and timeliness of patient test results regardless of where the test was performed and also to determine if laboratories are achieving those standards.:Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Concepts.definition: A Federal law establishing quality standards for all laboratory testing to ensure the accuracy, reliability and timeliness of patient test results regardless of where the test was performed and also to determine if laboratories are achieving those standards.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredName: Post Chemotherapy Age-Related Clonal Hematopoiesis Detection
Property.preferredDefinition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.:The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.:The gradual, clonal expansion of hematopoietic stem and progenitor cells carrying specific, disruptive, and recurrent genetic variants, in individuals without clear diagnosis of hematological malignancies. It is associated with an increased risk of developing hematologic cancers.:The activity of perceiving, discerning, discovering or identifying.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.

The gradual, clonal expansion of hematopoietic stem and progenitor cells carrying specific, disruptive, and recurrent genetic variants, in individuals without clear diagnosis of hematological malignancies. It is associated with an increased risk of developing hematologic cancers.
The act of perceiving, discerning, discovering, or identifying.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: Princess Margaret Cancer Centre, Toronto, ON

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.
